page.title: 18THE PARKEEPER
page.content: The park has been open for 40 years and I have been here for 20 years.Four people work here.I am responsible for the grass, greens, sports and ornamental areas.We use petrol mowers to cut the grass.In the pond which is cleared every 2 years are20 fish, mainly goldfish and carp. There are 60 trees in the park, the eldest being an 80 year old elm. The trees include cherry,almond,crab apple,lime, silver birch,sycamore,plane,horse chestnut and beech.Flowers include daffodils, tulips,crocus,geraniums,pansies, wallflowers and petunias. Up to 20 people can use the bowling green at a time.Thursday is busy as 6th formers from Adwick school play bowls.2 or 3 bowling matches are held during the summer.
